intro: Chrysanthemum segetale, commonly known as the grain chrysanthemum, is an annual flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and yellow to brown flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in fields or disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it both a weed and a potential source of herbal remedies.
